Headline: Product Leader @ Unilever | Digital Transformation Strategist | Innovation | AI | Cloud & Compliance Expert
Comment: The distinction between Awareness and Affinity is critical, especially today. Awareness can be rented with ad spend, but Affinity must be owned. The true cost of relying solely on Awareness is the 'Affinity Tax': the constantly increasing budget needed to re-acquire customers who have no loyalty. Brands with high affinity, conversely, benefit from a 'Loyalty Subsidy'‚Äîtheir best customers market for them through community and word-of-mouth. This subsidy lowers the effective cost of growth and is a far more robust financial indicator than simple top-line sales.
